description: The port of Goa Kingdom where ships arrive and depart. This is where Sabo's ship was destroyed by Saint Jalmack.

keyEvents.title: Sabo's Ship Destroyed
keyEvents.description: Saint Jalmack destroys Sabo's fishing boat with a bazooka as it passes his ship, witnessed by horrified onlookers at the port.
keyEvents.significance: This tragic event marks the location where Sabo apparently died and demonstrates the Celestial Dragons' casual cruelty.

geography: Coastal port with docks and harbor facilities
culturalSignificance: The port serves as Goa Kingdom's gateway to the sea and the outside world.

description: A mountain on Dawn Island where the Dadan Family's bandit hideout is located. This is where Luffy, Ace, and Sabo were raised.

keyEvents.title: Ace and Dadan's Return
keyEvents.description: Ace and Dadan return to Mt. Colubo after surviving the Gray Terminal fire, with Dadan suffering severe burns.
keyEvents.significance: Their safe return provides temporary relief before the devastating news of Sabo's death.

keyEvents.title: News of Sabo's Death Delivered
keyEvents.description: Dogra returns to Mt. Colubo with news that Sabo's ship was destroyed by a Celestial Dragon.
keyEvents.significance: This location becomes the site where Ace and Luffy learn of their brother's death.

keyEvents.title: Ace Consoles Luffy
keyEvents.description: On Mt. Colubo, Ace consoles Luffy and encourages him to live freely without regrets, honoring Sabo's memory.
keyEvents.significance: This conversation on the mountain establishes the brothers' resolve to live freely.

geography: Forested mountain with the Dadan Family hideout
culturalSignificance: The childhood home of Luffy, Ace, and Sabo, where their brotherly bond was formed.

description: The mountain bandit hideout on Mt. Colubo where the Dadan Family lives and where Luffy and Ace were raised.

keyEvents.title: Relief at Ace and Dadan's Return
keyEvents.description: The bandits and Luffy are relieved when Ace and Dadan safely return to the hideout from the Gray Terminal fire.
keyEvents.significance: The hideout serves as the safe haven where the family reunites after the fire.

keyEvents.title: Ace Restrained at the Hideout
keyEvents.description: Dadan and the bandits tie Ace to a tree at the hideout to prevent him from attempting to kill the Celestial Dragon.
keyEvents.significance: The hideout becomes the site where Dadan saves Ace's life by restraining him.

keyEvents.title: Sabo's Letter Delivered to Ace
keyEvents.description: At the hideout, Ace receives Sabo's final letter asking him to take care of Luffy.
keyEvents.significance: This intimate location witnesses Ace's emotional breakdown and acceptance of Sabo's dying wish.

geography: Wooden hideout structure in the forest of Mt. Colubo
culturalSignificance: The home where Luffy and Ace grew up under Dadan's care, forming their brotherly bonds.
